bestBHT.bht: As Agrippa presided, Paul, with his hand still chained, stretched it out in the formal attitude of an orator. Despite Festus being the one in control, Agrippa, as a king, took charge and permitted Paul to speak in his own defense. Paul took the opportunity to proclaim the name of Christ before kings and presented himself as the apostle and messenger of God. His speech aimed to address the accusations by recounting the history that led him to deliver his solemn message.

Paul seized the opportunity to bear the name of Christ before kings, presenting himself as the apostle and messenger of God, answering the accusations by sharing the history that led him to deliver his solemn message.
